ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got to further develop my playwriting skills and learned that there is no one way to write a play. Thank you Deb, for your unconditional love and support throughout the semester!
I learned so much about the genre of plays, about writing in general, and honestly about myself!
I developed my understanding of plot as a character transformation. I learned how to get into the practice of automatic writing both to conjure ideas and text for my play world and its characters.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would have liked to read people's scenes in class a bit more.

The course was very fun - always a laugh. Deb is also an extremely supportive professor who wants her students to succeed. It is so nice to feel loved and respected. On the other hand, I think some more concrete assignments would be helpful because most of the time we were just supposed to "work on our plays" which I feel like did not happen as frequently as I wanted to.

Strength: The openness of the class really allows playwrights to write whatever they are craving to explore.

Weakness: the open-ended nature of the class leaves students feeling unmoored and aimless for much of the semester. More scene prompts/exercises and a structured shift from standalone scenes to pursuing a longer piece would have potentially benefited the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but with ideally with a bit more structure.

I would totally recommend this course to another student! I am not a Theater Studies person and Deb welcomed me with open arms. However, there were some moments when I felt a little behind on theater terminology but I don't feel it inhibited my learning.
Absolutely! Playwriting is an incredible gift. And theres nothing like a deadline to get a writer writing!
